title: Responsive Design with Bootstrap
author: Dzenis Madzovic
description: Responsive design is a key aspect of modern web development, as users access websites on a variety of devices with different screen sizes. Bootstrap is a popular front-end framework that makes it easier to create responsive and mobile-first websites. This book provides a comprehensive guide to using Bootstrap for responsive design.

title: HTML - An Introduction
author: John Doe
description: HTML is the markup language used to create web pages. This book provides a comprehensive introduction to HTML, covering the basics of syntax and structure, as well as more advanced topics such as forms and multimedia.

title: CSS - An Introduction
author: Jane Smith
description: CSS is the styling language used to add visual design to web pages. This book provides a comprehensive introduction to CSS, covering the basics of selectors and properties, as well as more advanced topics such as layout and animation.

title: JavaScript - An Introduction
author: Samuel Lee
description: JavaScript is a programming language used to add interactivity and dynamic content to web pages. This book provides a comprehensive introduction to JavaScript, covering the basics of syntax and programming concepts, as well as more advanced topics such as the Document Object Model (DOM) and jQuery.

title: Learning Responsive Web Design
author: Marcotte, Ethan
description: This book covers the basics of responsive design, including fluid grids, flexible images, and media queries. It also provides practical advice for designing responsive websites that work across a range of devices.

title: HTML and CSS: Design and Build Websites
author: Jon Duckett
description: This book is a comprehensive introduction to both HTML and CSS, covering the basics of syntax and structure, as well as more advanced topics such as layout and typography. It includes plenty of practical examples and exercises to help readers build their skills.

title: CSS Mastery: Advanced Web Standards Solutions
author: Simon Collison
description: This book is aimed at intermediate to advanced CSS developers and provides a comprehensive guide to advanced CSS techniques, including layout, typography, and cross-browser compatibility. It includes plenty of practical examples and code snippets to help readers apply the concepts to their own projects.
